alert.note: Alert for Clay (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 25 at 8:28PM CDT until April 30 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Minnesota... Buffalo River near Hawley affecting Clay County. .Water continues to rise at Hawley. Crest is now expected to occur at Moderate flood stage on Tuesday. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Buffalo River near Hawley. * WHEN...Until early Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, MODERATE FLOOD STAGE. Railroad underpass at US Hwy 10 floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CDT Monday the stage was 8.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:45 PM CDT Monday was 8.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.0 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage Friday morning. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
